Subject: WS-REST2016 is looking for your API work
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=466918125; y=wDs_fbec2_UDTsbZMu7kvr0qf0XDXdFLsehMyp-Ng7B55D88B9RaCMI
X-Yahoo-Profile: ruben.verborgh
From: Ruben Verborgh <ruben.verborgh@...>

Dear all,

WS-REST2016 is a workshop at the International Conference on Web=
 Engineering,
taking place on 9 June 2016 in Lugano, Switzerland.
You contr=
ibution to this workshop is most welcome!

WS-REST2016 Workshop =96 http://=
ws-rest.org/2016/
    Submission: 16 March 2016
    Notification: 29 April =
2016
    Workshop: 9 June 2016

We especially welcome research and engineer=
ing work in the following areas:

=96 hypermedia-driven client/server appli=
cations
=96 Web API clients that make use of controls and context in server=
 responses
=96 Web APIs, platforms, and protocols for the Web of Things
=96=
 strategies to tackle the tremendous growth and heterogeneity of APIs
=96 a=
nalyses and studies around the practical, social, and economic factors surr=
ounding the development, use, and adoption of Web APIs and mashups
=96 less=
ons learned from the deployment, maintenance and evolution of Web APIs and =
mashups
=96 automated discovery, profiling, and testing of Web APIs
=96 dyn=
amic combination of and interactions between Web APIs

In addition to the t=
opics above, this workshop is also open to:

=96 applications of the REST a=
rchitectural style to novel domains
=96 design patterns and anti-patterns f=
or Web APIs
=96 automated Web API composition
=96 inverted REST (REST for p=
ush events)
=96 integration of pub/sub with REST
=96 REST-compliant transac=
tion models
=96 frameworks for Web API implementation and consumption
=96 m=
odeling Web APIs
=96 resource design and granularity
=96 evolution, version=
ing, and extension of Web APIs
=96 REST protocols beyond HTTP

We welcome f=
ull papers (up to 12 pages) and vision/demo/poster/breaking research papers=
 (up to 6 pages), size counted in LNCS format. Contacts with Springer are i=
n progress to publish ICWE workshop papers in a ICWE 2016 satellite event p=
ost-proceedings as Lecture Notes in Computer Science. Using the LNCS templa=
te is the fast track to the camera-ready version, but we accept publication=
s in other formats, such as HTML or EPUB.

Details and submission: http://w=
s-rest.org/2016/call-for-papers/

Cheers,

Ruben / Thomas / Carlos
WS-REST2=
016 organizers
